user.title: Maintenance Supporter
user.description: Set up your maintenance management system.

create_from_template.title: Select Template Category
create_from_template.description: Choose a category to browse predefined maintenance templates.

template_select.title: Select Template
template_select.description: Choose a maintenance template to use as a starting point.

template_customize.title: Customize Template
template_customize.description: Customize the {template_name} template. It includes {task_count} tasks: {task_list}.

data_description.name: A name for this maintenance object.
data_description.area_id: The area where this object is located.

data_description.default_warning_days: Number of days before a maintenance task is due to show a warning.
data_description.notifications_enabled: Send notifications when maintenance tasks become due.
data_description.notify_service: The notification service to use (e.g., notify.mobile_app_phone).

create_object.title: Create Maintenance Object
create_object.description: Define a device or asset to manage maintenance for.

data_description.name: A unique name for this maintenance object (e.g., 'Pool Pump', 'Car').
data_description.area_id: The area in your home where this object is located.
data_description.installation_date: When this object was installed or purchased.

task_menu.title: Maintenance Tasks
task_menu.description: Add maintenance tasks for {object_name}. Currently {task_count} task(s) defined.

data_description.name: A descriptive name for this task (e.g., 'Filter Cleaning', 'Oil Change').
data_description.schedule_type: How this task should be scheduled.

time_based.title: Time-based Schedule
time_based.description: Configure the time interval for this maintenance task.

data_description.interval_days: Number of days between maintenance runs.
data_description.last_performed: When this maintenance was last performed. Leave empty if never done.
data_description.warning_days: Number of days before due date to show a warning.

sensor_select.title: Select Trigger Sensor
sensor_select.description: Choose a Home Assistant entity to monitor for this maintenance task.

data_description.trigger_entity: Select the sensor entity that should trigger this maintenance task.

sensor_attribute.title: Select Attribute
sensor_attribute.description: Choose which value to monitor from {entity_id}. Current state: {current_state} {unit}

data_description.trigger_attribute: Select the entity state or a specific attribute to monitor.

trigger_type.title: Trigger Type
trigger_type.description: How should the sensor value trigger maintenance?

data_description.trigger_type: Threshold: triggers when value exceeds limits. Counter: triggers after accumulating a target value. State Change: triggers after a number of state transitions.

trigger_threshold.title: Threshold Configuration

data_description.trigger_above: Trigger maintenance when value exceeds this threshold.
data_description.trigger_below: Trigger maintenance when value falls below this threshold.
data_description.trigger_for_minutes: Value must exceed threshold for this many minutes before triggering.
data_description.interval_days: Optional time-based safety interval in addition to the sensor trigger.
data_description.warning_days: Number of days before due date to show a warning.

data_description.trigger_target_value: Trigger maintenance when this accumulated value is reached.
data_description.trigger_delta_mode: If enabled, counts the difference from a baseline instead of the absolute value.
data_description.interval_days: Optional time-based safety interval in addition to the counter trigger.
data_description.warning_days: Number of days before due date to show a warning.

data_description.trigger_from_state: Only count transitions from this state. Leave empty for any.
data_description.trigger_to_state: Only count transitions to this state. Leave empty for any.
data_description.trigger_target_changes: Number of matching state changes before triggering maintenance.
data_description.interval_days: Optional time-based safety interval in addition to the state change trigger.
data_description.warning_days: Number of days before due date to show a warning.

manual.title: Manual Schedule
manual.description: This task has no automatic schedule. You can mark it as due manually.

data_description.warning_days: Number of days before due date to show a warning.
data_description.notes: Additional notes or instructions for this task.

error.name_exists: A maintenance object with this name already exists.
error.no_tasks: At least one maintenance task is required.
error.invalid_entity: The selected entity does not exist or has no numeric data.
error.invalid_attribute: The selected attribute is not available on this entity.
error.invalid_threshold: At least one threshold (above or below) must be set.
error.invalid_interval: Interval must be a positive number.

abort.already_configured: This maintenance object is already configured.
abort.template_not_found: The selected template was not found.

advanced_features.title: Advanced Features
advanced_features.description: Choose which advanced features to show in the UI. Disabling a feature hides it from the interface but does not delete any data.

data_description.advanced_adaptive_visible: Show EWA, Weibull analysis, and interval suggestions for tasks.
data_description.advanced_predictions_visible: Show sensor degradation analysis and threshold prediction charts.
data_description.advanced_seasonal_visible: Show seasonal factor charts and monthly adjustment data.
data_description.advanced_budget_visible: Show monthly/yearly budget tracking and alerts.
data_description.advanced_checklists_visible: Show task checklists for step-by-step completion.

general_settings.title: General Settings
general_settings.description: Configure basic settings for Maintenance Supporter.

data_description.notifications_enabled: Send notifications when maintenance tasks become due or are overdue.
data_description.notify_service: The notification service to use (e.g., notify.mobile_app_phone).
data_description.panel_enabled: Show a Maintenance Supporter panel in the sidebar.

notification_settings.title: Notification Settings
notification_settings.description: Configure when and how often notifications are sent for each status.

data_description.notify_due_soon_interval_hours: How often to repeat the due-soon reminder. Set to 0 for a single notification.
data_description.notify_overdue_interval_hours: How often to repeat the overdue reminder. Set to 0 for a single notification.
data_description.notify_triggered_interval_hours: How often to repeat the triggered notification. Set to 0 for a single notification.
data_description.max_notifications_per_day: Maximum number of notifications per day. Set to 0 for unlimited.
data_description.notification_bundling_enabled: Send a single summary notification when multiple tasks need attention.
data_description.notification_bundle_threshold: Minimum number of tasks to trigger a bundled notification.

budget_settings.title: Budget Settings
budget_settings.description: Set monthly and yearly maintenance budgets to track spending.

data_description.budget_monthly: Maximum monthly maintenance spending. Set to 0 to disable.
data_description.budget_yearly: Maximum yearly maintenance spending. Set to 0 to disable.
data_description.budget_alerts_enabled: Send a notification when spending exceeds the alert threshold.
data_description.budget_alert_threshold: Percentage of budget at which to send an alert.

notification_actions.title: Interactive Actions
notification_actions.description: Configure action buttons shown on mobile notifications (requires Companion App).

data_description.action_complete_enabled: Adds a button to mark the task as completed directly from the notification.
data_description.action_skip_enabled: Adds a button to skip the current maintenance cycle from the notification.
data_description.action_snooze_enabled: Adds a button to postpone the notification reminder.
data_description.snooze_duration_hours: How long to postpone notifications when snooze is pressed.

manage_groups.title: Manage Groups
manage_groups.description: Select a group to manage or create a new one.

add_group.title: Add Group
add_group.description: Create a new maintenance group to organize related tasks.

data_description.group_name: A name for this group (e.g., 'Spring Maintenance').

manage_tasks.title: Manage Tasks
manage_tasks.description: Select a task to edit or remove.

edit_checklist.title: Edit Checklist
edit_checklist.description: Define checklist steps for {task_name}. Enter one step per line.

data_description.checklist_text: Enter each checklist step on a separate line. These steps will be shown when completing the task.

delete_task.title: Delete Task
delete_task.description: Are you sure you want to delete the task {task_name}? This cannot be undone.

opt_sensor_attribute.title: Select Attribute
opt_sensor_attribute.description: Choose which value to monitor from {entity_id}. Current state: {current_state} {unit}

opt_trigger_threshold.title: Threshold Configuration

adaptive_scheduling.title: Adaptive Scheduling
adaptive_scheduling.description: Configure smart interval adaptation for {task_name}. The system learns from your completion feedback to suggest better intervals.

data_description.adaptive_enabled: When enabled, the system will learn from your feedback and suggest optimal maintenance intervals.
data_description.ewa_alpha: How quickly the algorithm adapts to new data. Higher = more responsive, lower = more stable.
data_description.min_interval_days: The shortest interval the system will ever recommend.
data_description.max_interval_days: The longest interval the system will ever recommend.
data_description.seasonal_enabled: Adjust recommendations based on seasonal patterns learned from your maintenance history.
data_description.sensor_prediction_enabled: Analyze sensor trends to predict when thresholds will be reached and suggest earlier maintenance if needed.
data_description.environmental_entity: Link a temperature, humidity or pressure sensor to correlate environmental conditions with maintenance intervals.

complete.name: Complete Maintenance
complete.description: Mark a maintenance task as completed.

entity_id.name: Entity
entity_id.description: The maintenance sensor entity to complete.

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional notes about the maintenance performed.

duration.name: Duration
duration.description: Duration of the maintenance in minutes.

reset.name: Reset Maintenance
reset.description: Reset the last performed date of a maintenance task.

entity_id.name: Entity
entity_id.description: The maintenance sensor entity to reset.

date.name: Date
date.description: The date to set as last performed. Defaults to today.

entity_id.name: Entity
entity_id.description: The maintenance sensor entity to skip.

reason.name: Reason
reason.description: Optional reason for skipping the maintenance.

export_data.name: Export Data
export_data.description: Export all maintenance data as JSON or YAML.

format.name: Format
format.description: Output format for the exported data (json or yaml).

include_history.name: Include History
include_history.description: Whether to include task history entries in the export.

init.title: Missing trigger entity
init.description:
The sensor entity `{entity_id}` configured as trigger for task "{task_name}" on object "{object_name}" is no longer available.

Choose how to resolve this issue:

replace_entity.title: Replace trigger entity
replace_entity.description: Select a new entity to replace `{entity_id}` as trigger for task "{task_name}" on "{object_name}".

data_description.new_entity_id: Select the new sensor entity to use as trigger.

remove_trigger.title: Remove sensor trigger
remove_trigger.description:
This will remove the sensor trigger from task "{task_name}" on "{object_name}" and convert the schedule to time-based or manual. The maintenance history will be preserved.

Previous trigger entity: `{entity_id}`

no_coordinator_for_entity.message: No maintenance coordinator found for entity {entity_id}.

no_task_for_entity.message: No maintenance task found for entity {entity_id}.
